intro: Spiesia didymophysa, commonly known as the twin-fruit spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, small, yellowish flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub with succulent, often hairy stems and leaves. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are borne in pairs, giving it its common name. Spiesia didymophysa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
